episode_title: 315 - The One Where Ross and Rachel Take A Break

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey is taking a jar of olives out of the fridge.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, how much will you give me to eat this whole jar of olives?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I won’t give you anything, but you’ll owe me 2.95.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Done.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey. I need an atlas! I need an atlas!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why? (in a motherlike tone) Do you have a report due?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I have a date with this diplomat I met while I was giving free massages outside the UN and, I don’t know where his country is.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, let’s start with the free messages outside the UN.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh!! That’s my new thing. I figure bodies at peace, make peace.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! You might just get the first Nobel prize in rubbing. So what country is this guy from?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ick-neck-tree-anis… There’s a ‘g’ in there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Where’s that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: In your atlas!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t have an atlas.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, but wait I do have a globe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hold on.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So Pheebs what’s this guy like?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, well he’s very dashing, y’know, and umm, very, very sophisticated, and he doesn’t speak any English, but according to his translator, he totally gets me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: ‘Kay, here you go. (Hands her this tiny little globe.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What is this?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s a globe and, a pencil sharpener.
(Phoebe puts the globe right up next to her eye to try and find the country.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, does anybody need anything copied? I’m going down to the Xerox place.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, no thanks.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay listen, just give me anything I can make two of.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, if you don’t have anything to copy, why are you going down there?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, are you just going down there to gawk at that hot girl with the belly button ring again?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah! You wanna come?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!

content.description: The Xerox place, Chandler and Joey are waiting in line.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Come on Chloe! Finish up with your customer first. Come on Chloe! Come on Chloe!!

content.speaker: Isaac
content.text: Can I help you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh-oh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, y’know what, we’re having second thoughts about our copying needs. And we’ll need a little more time to think about it.

content.speaker: Isaac
content.text: Chloe, switch with me, there’s some guys here that got a crush on you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, that hurt us.

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Hi guys. I haven’t seen you since this morning.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well ah, ……y’know.

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Hey, what are you guys doing tomorrow night?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Both of us? (points to Chandler and himself)

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Maybe. Does that scare ya?
(They both start laughing. They look at each other, stop and step apart a little bit.)

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Relax. It’s just Issac’s D.J.-ing at the Philly. You should come.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We’ll be there.

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Great. I’ll ah, see ya then.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, rock on. (Does the ‘Hang 10’ sign, then hides his face in shame.)

content.description: A Street, Phoebe is walking along with the diplomat (Sergei) and his translator (Mischa).

content.speaker: Mischa
content.text: He’s says, ‘Walking with you makes this strange city, feel like home.’

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Me too. Although this city is my home, so. So that’s dumb what I said, don’t tell him I said that. Umm, you make something up. (Mischa does so and Sergei kisses her hand.) Nice, (to Mischa) thank you. This is me. Here.
(Sergei goes up to her at her door and says something.)

content.speaker: Mischa
content.text: Your eyes are very pretty.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank you, very much! Oh! (to Sergei) Thank you!
(Sergei says something and leans in to kiss her, but just as he’s about to…)

content.speaker: Mischa
content.text: He would like to kiss you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, y’know what, you don’t have to do that now. (Mischa translates that to Sergei) No-no-no-no!! Not him, you don’t! (Mischa tells Sergei he can proceed and steps away) Well the moment’s over.
(Sergei says something and kisses her.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Mischa
content.text: Oy!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is showing Monica where Sergei’s country is.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: See there it is right there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! It’s small.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. But Sergei said it took the Germans six weeks to get all the way across it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So you had fun, huh?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Except for, y’know when you’re on a date and you’re getting along really great but the guy’s translator keeps getting in the way.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe and Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What is ah, Rach in her room?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no, she’s still at work, but she told me to tell you to call her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh what?! Is she gonna cancel on me again?! How can she do this? Doesn’t she know it’s our anniversary?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right ah, Ross, this is the extent of my knowledge on the subject. (holds up a notepad) Call Rachel.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s that on the bottom?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh that’s my doodle of a ladybug, with a top hat. (to Phoebe) She’s fancy.
(Ross calls Rachel)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, honey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, hi.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, what’s going on?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, there was a disaster in shipping and I’ve got to get this order in. Honey, I’m so sorry, but it looks like I’m gonna be here all night.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What, do you, well umm, oh how about I come up there?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No-no-no, no, honey please, I’ve got, I’ve just have so much to deal with.
[Cut to kitchen.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Anyway, I’m going out with Sergei again tonight, and um, could you come and be the translator’s date? So that when we, it’s time for our alone time, you two could split off. Y’know, he’s really, he’s kinda cute.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, well kinda cute, like really kinda cute, or kinda cute like your friend Spackel Back Larry?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, don’t call him that! His name is Spackel Back Harry!

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler and Joey are sitting on the big couch.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, y’know what, maybe we should get going. I mean what time did Chloe say we should be there?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What time is it now?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah all right, so we’ll hang out.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah. Hey, remember when she brought up that thing about the three of us?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes. Vividly.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She was kidding about that right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I-I-I think so. (Pauses and thinks about it for a second) Yeah, I-I think so…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: God, that would be weird it that situation presented itself tonight, huh?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. Yeah, I mean what, what would we do?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude, I don’t know.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She was kidding.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She was… But y’know what, just in case, maybe we should come up with a set of ground rules.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, for sure. Okay. Probably want the first thing to be, never open your eyes. Y’know, because you don’t want to be doing something and then look up and see something you don’t want to be seeing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah. Good call, nice one. Hold it!! Hold it! What if me eyes are closed, and, and my hand is out there… (holds his arm out and pretends to grab something with his hand.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah!! Okay! Eyes open at all times! Oh, hey, how do we decide where we… (clears throat) y’know each would, (clears throat again) y’know (pause) be?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Right. Right. Well ah, y’know we could flip for it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I guess, but what’s like heads and what’s tails?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well it you don’t know that, then I don’t want to do this with you.

content.description: Rachel’s office, Rachel and a co-worker (Sophie) are dealing with the crisis.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, no, no, I’m looking at a purchase order right here and it clearly states that we ordered the Rivera bikini in a variety of sizes and colours. And… (listens) What does it matter, what I’m wearing?! Can I please speak to your supervisor? (listens) Thank you. (to Sophie) We’re holding.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh!! My God, what are you doing here?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well you said you couldn’t go out so… (pulls the cover off of the basket)

content.speaker: Sophie
content.text: You brought a picnic, oh, what a boyfriend. That’s it, on Monday I start wearing make-up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross honey, this is very nice, but, but I-I got a crisis.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, but I got cous-cous!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, honey, I’m sorry, I know it’s our anniversary but I told you on the phone I don’t have time to stop.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, you don’t have to stop, I’m invisible, I’m not here. (lights a candle)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But I don’t, hmm… (on phone) Oh, who approved that order?! (listens) Well there is no Mark Robbinson in this office. (to Sophie) Get me Mark on the phone!

content.speaker: Sophie
content.text: I love Mark. (to Ross) Do you know Mark?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, let me just check that with what I got here, all right see 038 is not the number for (Ross starts making a lot of noise with a handheld pepper grinder) this store, 038 is Atlanta. And I…(stops and looks at Ross)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Pepper?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: None for me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay sorry, whew.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry, as I was saying the store number is wrong, and I’m sorry but that’s… (notices a fire that Ross’s candle has started) Oh my God!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, that’s a fire. Oh yeah. Oh yeah.
content.parenthetical: putting out the fire with a squeeze bottle of water

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Excuse me, I’m sorry, I’m gonna have to call you back, I’ve got a Schemp in my office. (hangs up) (to Ross) What are you doing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry. But ah, hey, oh, somebody’s off the phone, how ‘bout a glass of wine by the fire, I could get it going again.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross you’re not listening to me, I don’t have time to stop.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on Rach, you don’t have what, ten minutes?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t have ten minutes!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? (to Sophie) Sophie, does she have ten minutes?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, Ross!!! I told you I don’t!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Don’t yell at me okay, this is the most I’ve seen you all week.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Look, I cannot do this right now, okay, I’ve got a deadline, would you just go home, I’ll talk to you later. (storms out)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, but wait…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good bye!
(Ross starts to pack up the picnic in anger, and throws a three hole punch in the basket.)

content.speaker: Sophie
content.text: Actually, that’s our three hole punch.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross is eating the picnic as Rachel comes home from work.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi. Look um, about what happened earlier…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, hey, well, I-I completely understand. You were, you were stressed.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I was gonna give you a chance to apologise to me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: For what? For letting you throw me out of your office?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You had no right coming down to my office Ross. You do not bring a picnic basket to somebody’s work! Unless maybe they were a park ranger!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, well excuse me for wanting to be with my girlfriend on our anniversary, boy what an ass am I.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But I told you, I didn’t have the time!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, well you never have the time. I mean, I don’t feel like I even have a girlfriend anymore, Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wh, Ross what do you want from me? You want me, you want me to quit my job so you can feel like you have a girlfriend?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, but it’d be nice if you realised, it’s just a job!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Just a job!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross do you realise this is the first time in my life I’m doing something I actually care about. This is the first time in my life I’m doing something that I’m actually good at. I mean. if you don’t get that…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, hey, I get that, okay, I get that big time. And I’m happy for ya, but I’m tired of having a relationship with your answering machine! Okay, I don’t know what to do anymore.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well neither do I!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is this about Mark?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, it’s not, it’s not.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God. I cannot keep having this same fight over and over again, Ross, no, you’re, you’re, you’re making this too hard.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh I’m, I’m making this too hard. Okay, what do you want me to do.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know, I don’t know. Urrrgh! Look, maybe we should take a break.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, okay, fine, you’re right. Let’s ah, let’s take a break, (goes to the door) let’s cool off, okay, let’s get some frozen yogart, or something.. (opens the door)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. (Ross is standing in the doorway.) A break from us.
(Ross looks at her, then leaves slamming the door behind him.)

content.description: The Philly, Chandler and Joey are talking to Chloe.

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: And the advances in collating in the past five years, I mean we just got in an X-5000, y’know. The X-5000 makes the X-50 look like a T-71.
(Chandler agrees in an absolutely bored way.)

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Hey, it’s the dinosaur guy. (runs over to Ross) Hi, Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, hi Chloe.

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: I want you to met some friends of mine. (Introduces him to Chandler and Joey) This guy is my hero, he comes in with some stuff he wants it blown up 400%, we said we don’t do that, and he says you gotta. And y’know what, we did it. And now anytime anybody wants 400, we just say ‘let’s Ross it!’

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And that’s the only colour that comes in.

content.speaker: Isaac
content.text: Yo, Chloe, do you have a quarter for the condom machine?

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Oh! (storms off)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, what are you doing here? I thought tonight was your big anniversary dinner.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, little change in plans. Ahh, we’re gonna break-up instead.
(Chandler and Joey stare at each other in shock.)

content.description: A Restaurant, Monica and Phoebe are on their dates with Sergei and Mischa.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, and I can also speak a little French. Voulez-vous coucher avec moi ce soir? (Mischa laughs) Why? What did I say?

content.speaker: Mischa
content.text: Well, you just asked if I wanted to go to bed with you tonight.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! No wonder I get such great service at Cafe Maurice.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Knock, knock, knock, knock, hi. Um, could you please tell Sergei that um, I was fascinated by what Boutros Boutros Gali said in the New York Times.
content.parenthetical: laughing and banging her spoon on the table

content.text: (Mischa does so.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You didn’t say Boutros Boutros Gali.

content.speaker: Mischa
content.text: Boutros Boutros Gali.
(Sergei responds.)

content.speaker: Mischa
content.text: He says he was too.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Interesting.

content.speaker: Mischa
content.text: So I was wondering…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, ah, before you get all talky again, umm, could you also please tell Sergei that I really like his suit.
(Mischa does so, and Sergei complements Phoebe, and says it slowly)

content.speaker: Mischa
content.text: Eh, he said, thank you very much, he thinks you look very pretty tonight, your hair, golden like the sun. (to Monica) So your a chef?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m also thinking about opening up my own restaurant.

content.speaker: Mischa
content.text: Oh, really.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Monica, can I talk to you behind my menu, please. (Behind the menu) What are you doing?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I was having a conversation.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah but, Mischa is so interested in you, that Sergei and I haven’t been able to say two words to each other.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What do you want me to do? Just sit here silently while you three have a conversation?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That would be great. Thank you.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is lying in front of the bay window, and the phone rings.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello!
content.parenthetical: jumping up to answer the phone

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Oh, hi. It’s Mark.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: What? Is it my breath?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Sorry, I just thought you were somebody else. Hi!

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Hi. Well, look, I was just gonna leave a message, isn’t tonight your, your big anniversary dinner?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Well, umm…

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Rach, are you okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I’m fine.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: You wanna talk, I mean I can come over?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! Really, no, please, please, that’s, that’s okay.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: All right, all right, I’m coming over, and I’m bringing Chinese food.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, yeah, I’m not, I’m not hungry.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: It’s for me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. Okay, bye.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So what are you gonna do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What can I do? One person wants to break-up, you break-up.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, no way! Come on, this is you guys, call her and work it out.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh come on, we just had this huge fight, all right, don’t I have to wait a while?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, this isn’t like swimming after you eat, pick up the phone!!
(Ross goes to call her.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know that whole swimming thing is a myth.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, tell that to my Uncle Lenny.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why? What happened to him?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nothing, he’s just really believes in that.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Mark is there, opening Chinese food boxes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, and then, we got into this big, stupid fight. I just, it was awful. I told him he treats me like a park ranger, or something, oh and then I told him I wanted to take a break, I don’t want to take a break.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Wow. I’m sorry. Eggroll?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. (grabs an eggroll) And then I called him, and he wasn’t there.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Well, then he’s, he’s probably just, out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, thank you that’s very helpful, I’m glad you came over.
(The phone rings and Rachel answers it.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi! It’s me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! Oh, I’m so glad you called.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really? I’ve been thinking, this is crazy, I mean don’t, don’t you think we can work on this?

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Hey, what do you want to drink?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Who’s that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nobody.

content.speaker: Mark
content.text: Is it okay if I finish the apple juice?
(Rachel mouths ‘Shoot!’ or something similar.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is that Mark?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm, honey, look he just came over to…
[Cut to The Philly.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah! Got it! (slams the phone down, and walks back to the bar.)

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Hey, dinosaur guy, look at you, so sad. Come dance.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah, that’s okay, thanks.

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Hey, you don’t have to smile. You just have to dance.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I don’t feel like dancing, I feel like having a drink. Okay?

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Oh, okay. (to the bartender) Hey, two beers. (sits down next to him)

content.speaker: Mischa
content.text: And the vet said it was time. And so from half a world away, while my Mother held the phone to his ear, I said good bye to my dog,. In seven languages.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh. (to Phoebe) Can I have a tissue?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, yeah, sure. I just hope you, hope you don’t accidentally suck it up through your nose and choke on it.
(Sergei says something to Mischa.)

content.speaker: Mischa
content.text: Sergei, would like to apologise for my behaviour tonight.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, tell him, apology accepted.
(Mischa does so.)

content.speaker: Mischa
content.text: Oh, he’s unbelievable. I mean for the first time in three years somebody wants to actually want to talk to me, but do you think he would let me enjoy that, no!! (to Sergei) You silly diplomat, why don’t you learn some English, Sergei?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Excuse me, but umm, isn’t he paying for your dinner?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, the man’s dog just died.
(Sergei insults Mischa, and they get into a huge fight, in Russian.)

content.speaker: Mischa
content.text: I have just resigned my post. Would you care to accompany me to the Rainbow Room? I have diplomatic coupons.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It will be my pleasure. (to Phoebe) My guy has diplomatic coupons. Your guy can’t even say coupons. (they leave)

content.speaker: Sergei
content.text: Uh, (picks up a plate) plate?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Plate! Yes, plate.

content.speaker: Sergei
content.text: Plate. Plate. Plate.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: See, we don’t need them.

content.speaker: Sergei
content.text: Plate?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.description: [Scene: The Philly, With or Without You is playing. (Which is the same song Ross played for Rachel in TOW the List.)]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I like this song.

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Well, you’re practically dancing already. Why don’t you just do it over here?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, no, no.

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: What? Are you married? ‘Cause that’s okay.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is next to the bay window again, Mark has left.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, be home, be home, be home, be home, be home, be home. Be home. Be home, be home, be home. Oh, you’re not home.
content.parenthetical: picks up the phone and calls Ross

content.description: The Philly, Ross is dancing with Chloe.

content.speaker: Chloe
content.text: Still no smile?
(She kisses him. Ross leans back for a second, and then they both kiss, more passionately this time.)
To Be Continued…

content.description: [Scene: Central Perk, Sergei is teaching Phoebe how to sing American Pie, by Don Maclean.]

content.text: (Both Phoebe and him are singing along and they get to the chorus.)

content.speaker: Sergei
content.text: Touchet, touchet, Miss Americccan pie. (stops to correct Phoebe) Ameri-ccan.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ameri-can.

content.speaker: Sergei
content.text: Ameri-ccan.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ameri-can. Y’know it’s a very hard language. Let’s do it again.
(They start singing, and Phoebe covers her mouth at the American part.)

content.speaker: Sergei
content.text: Everybody!! (In his language, and continues.)
content.parenthetical: to the rest of Central Perk
